posts.post_content: This is really useful in a good variety of deck types-discard is good for control or mill, since your opponent will be short on cards (and therefore have less options that you need to limit, or less ways to counter your milling), second ability is good for combos or for pulling yourself out of a tight spot (grab a lifegain card or something), and third ability creates an army of the undead that will probably not be brought down by anything less than Wrath of God or Planar Cleansing.

posts.post_content: Very tempted to try running her in my black vampire deck. The discard is nice for card avantage, but I'm really salivating at the prospect of forcing the Vampire Nocturnus boost with the second ability. Depending on the deck you're facing you may be forced to keep from putting a really good card on top (ie. another Nocturnus might be dangerous on top if your opponent is milling and has Hedron Crabs out), but the vampire deck is based around speed, and what better way to get a boost of speed than to turn your army into +2/+1 fliers at will thanks to Vess. It also provides defense for her from fliers, unless of course your opponent mills you onto a swamp. Plus, if you really need land to bring out more powerful creatures and spells (for example, Malakir Bloodwitch to win the game, or that one which takes half the opponent's life and you have a non-land on top... you can attack first, and then tutor out a swamp after (depending on the opponent's creature situation of course).
posts.html:

Posted By: JaxsonBateman (10/26/2009 10:49:12 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Anyone wanting to know how to play a planeswalker:  
  
See the #5 in the bottom right hand corner? That's basically what they need to live. Every time you play that +1 ability, it bounces that number up by one. So by making a player discard a card, she becomes a 6 instead of a 5. Conversely, when you use that -2 ability, it will take her from a 5 to a 3. When that number reaches 0, the planeswalker dies. Its number can also be reduced by direct damaging cards, like [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt), or its inferior counterpart, [shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shock). So to use that beastly -8 ability, you'll have to build her up to 9. Hope that helped.
posts.html:
@Anyone wanting to know how to play a planeswalker:

See the #5 in the bottom right hand corner? That's basically what they need to live. Every time you play that +1 ability, it bounces that number up by one. So by making a player discard a card, she becomes a 6 instead of a 5. Conversely, when you use that -2 ability, it will take her from a 5 to a 3. When that number reaches 0, the planeswalker dies. Its number can also be reduced by direct damaging cards, like lightning bolt, or its inferior counterpart, shock. So to use that beastly -8 ability, you'll have to build her up to 9. Hope that helped.

posts.post_content: She's not underpowered, like some people may say. It's just that she's really well-balanced, unlike the more popular and pretty broken 'walkers like Garruk (seriously, he should have been costed 5 mana, and -4 for his ultimate is WAY too cheap). All of her abilities are useful, especially the second one. She can be a repeatable Vampiric Tutor minus the life loss, and that truly works wonders in my MBC. An all around great card. 4,5/5!

posts.post_content:
Overall, a very usefull card;  
  
I've lost count of how many times her first ability has saved me from counterspells (coupled with a few [Sedraxis Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sedraxis Specter)(s) ), and her second ability has gotten a [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation ) into play; the shuffle thing is also rather useful if your opponent has some library-ordering cards.(though I can't remember if there are any)  
  
And let's not forget the last, epic finish! Just add in a [Sarkhan Vol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan Vol) and a [Fury of the Horde](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fury of the Horde) / [Relentless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless )  and you have a winner!  
  
simply ***beautiful***. (pun intended)
posts.html:

And let's not forget the last, epic finish! Just add in a Sarkhan Vol and a Fury of the Horde / Relentless and you have a winner!

simply beautiful. (pun intended)
